title: Internal and External Inspections
description: Systematic internal audit program and procedures for handling external inspections, including calibration and verification of measuring and monitoring devices

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for how internal audits are to be performed at the operations, including frequency and covering all processes impacting food safety and the related documents and records?
mandatoryStatements: Internal audit procedure is documented
Audit frequency is defined (minimum annually for all food safety processes)
Procedure covers all processes impacting food safety
Audit scope includes review of documents and records
Audit checklist or criteria are defined
Auditor qualifications and independence requirements are specified
Audit planning, execution, and reporting processes are described
Follow-up on audit findings is required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of internal audit procedure for adequacy, verification that all food safety processes are audited at required frequency
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that audits are conducted per schedule, immediate scheduling of overdue audits

requirements.text: Is there documented evidence of the internal audits performed, detailing findings and corrective actions?
mandatoryStatements: Internal audit reports are maintained for all audits conducted
Reports document audit date, auditor(s), scope, and areas audited
All findings (conformances and non-conformances) are documented
Non-conformances are categorized by severity
Corrective actions are documented for all non-conformances
Responsible parties and target completion dates are identified
Verification of corrective action effectiveness is documented
Audit records are retained per record retention procedure
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of audit records for completeness, quarterly verification of corrective action closure
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation of audit findings, monthly monitoring of corrective action progress

requirements.text: Are there written procedures for handling regulatory inspections?
mandatoryStatements: Procedure for handling regulatory inspections is documented
Procedure identifies who is authorized to interact with inspectors
Inspector escort and access protocols are defined
Document and record access procedures are specified
Response to inspector requests is described
Post-inspection follow-up process is defined
Communication with management during inspection is specified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of inspection handling procedure, verification after each regulatory inspection that procedure was followed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate notification to management when regulatory inspection begins, real-time adherence to procedure during inspection

requirements.text: Are there records of regulatory inspections and/or contracted inspections, company responses and corrective actions, if any?
mandatoryStatements: Records of all regulatory and contracted inspections are maintained
Inspection reports from authorities are kept on file
Company responses to inspection findings are documented
Corrective actions for inspection findings are documented and tracked
Verification of corrective action completion is documented
Clearance or follow-up communications from authorities are maintained
Records are organized and readily retrievable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of inspection records and corrective action closure, verification that all findings are addressed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation of inspection results, weekly monitoring of regulatory corrective action progress

requirements.text: Are there documented calibration and/or accuracy verification procedures for measuring and monitoring devices used in the operations that are related to the safety of the product?
mandatoryStatements: Calibration/accuracy verification procedures are documented
All measuring and monitoring devices related to food safety are identified
Calibration frequency is defined for each device type
Calibration methods and standards are specified
Acceptable accuracy tolerances are defined
Procedure identifies who is authorized to perform calibration
Actions to take when device is out of calibration are specified
Traceability to national or international standards is established where applicable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of calibration procedures and device inventory, quarterly verification that calibrations are current
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Calibration performed at specified frequencies, immediate verification before first use of new devices

requirements.text: Are calibration and/or accuracy verification records maintained and are they consistent with the requirements outlined in the SOP(s) for instruments and measuring devices requiring calibration?
mandatoryStatements: Calibration records are maintained for all devices requiring calibration
Records include device identification, calibration date, results, and calibrator identification
Records show traceability to calibration standards used
Calibration frequency in records matches procedure requirements
Out-of-calibration results and corrective actions are documented
Records are organized and retrievable by device
Historical calibration data is maintained for trend analysis
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of calibration records for completeness and compliance, quarterly spot-check of device calibration status
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation of calibration results, monthly review of upcoming calibration due dates

capaInject: If internal audit not conducted per schedule: conduct audit immediately, investigate scheduling failure, implement reminder system
If audit findings not addressed: immediate action on critical findings, escalate to management, set aggressive completion dates
If regulatory inspection identifies non-conformances: immediate containment, complete corrective actions per regulatory timeline, verify effectiveness
If measuring device found out of calibration: immediate removal from service, assess impact on product safety, recalibrate or replace within 24 hours
If calibration records incomplete: reconstruct records if possible, implement enhanced calibration tracking system within 30 days
traceabilityInject: Internal audit records must trace findings to specific areas, dates, and corrective actions
Regulatory inspection records must trace from initial findings through corrective action verification and closure
Calibration records must trace device history including all calibrations, adjustments, and out-of-spec events
All measuring devices must be uniquely identified and traceable to calibration records
